title: How to change IDA to use Python 3.7 and not Python 2.7: "do not have the x86_64 architecture"
content:
I have IDA 6.95, Python 2.7 and Python 3.7. Currently when I start IDA it uses Python 2.7: 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Python 2.7.12 (v2.7.12:d33e0cf91556, Jun 27 2016, 15:19:22) [MSC v.1500 32 bit (Intel)] 
IDAPython v1.7.0 final (serial 0) (c) The IDAPython Team 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I wanted to change it to 3.7. I tried to do it with 
idapyswitch.exe
but failed: 
C:\Program Files (x86)\IDA 6.95>idapyswitch.exe --force-path "C:\Users\user1\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37-32\python3.dll"
Cannot determine python library version for "C:\Users\user1\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37-32\python3.dll": DLLs in directory "C:\Users\user1\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37-32" do not have the x86_64 architecture
How can I change it, I don't understand what is the problem with the architecture of the files?

comments.text: Python 3 support came with ida 7.4 I thought
make sure you install python3 64bit. (32bit only would not work)
